intro: Cyphostemma elephantopus, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in rocky or wooded areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant.
